Posts.Content: Aug 18, 2009 08:20AM rockysmom wrote: Thank you NatsFan Lisa-e- I don't even try to measure for my trunkal part. I usually notice increased swelling first under my arm. I'll suddenly find myself moving my arm akwardly like to try and unstick something. Don't know if that makes any sense. It's just an odd feeling I get and my bra gets uncomfortable. My back area I notice when I sit and lean back. It seems that if I can catch it in the "uncomfortable underarm" stage I can keep it pretty well controlled. If I don't notice that, I end up in some real pain trying to sleep.

I would like to be able to start doing this at home to make sure I am keeping things under control. Although my usual swell areas are trunkal in nature, my arm does swell a little bit and feel heavy and tired. thanks in advance! Posts.Content: May 23, 2009 08:45AM rockysmom wrote: If it was the xray tech that called, they may just want to get another view or two. (fingrs crossed that's all it is!) The Doctor is YOUR "employee", you have every right to insist on a biopsy if that is what you want. If he doesn't want to or gives you a hard time, by all means get a second opinion. I had my first "lump" over 20 years ago. Had a needle biopsy done and was told it was nothing. Doctor said they could remove it to make absolutely sure, but he was very confident is was just fibroid. I decided against surgery. However, after several months I was still worrying. Called the Doctor back and said I'd decided to have it removed. He said no problem and we got it out. Turned out to be just fibroid- so they were right. As for the amount of time passing- I cound my cancer mass in October. Didn't get the diagnosis until January, and surgery in Feb. A few extra months usually won't change the diagnosis. I hope you are able to enjoy the weekend without stressing too  much. (((hugs)))
